intro: Urophyllum filiformistipulatum, commonly known as the slender-stipule urophyllum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, thread-like stipules and small, clustered flowers with five petals. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a hairy texture. Urophyllum filiformistipulatum is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
